result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Williams

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard Williams in court, in custody.  Attorney Claude-Allan Milhomme in court for Richard Williams.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Binger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  DE Motion to Modify Bond. Arguments heard. Court denies Motion. Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Richard Williams in court, in custody.  Attorney Claude-Allan Milhomme in court for Richard Williams.  Prosecuting attorney Alexandra Kathleen Smathers in court for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: Attorney and DE request adjournment. DE waives time for preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
